TopicTitle: Fixes for the randomly generated ground?

Articles.Content:
One of my very large problems with ksp is the randomly generated ground. Just about every time i load the ground is little different causing misalignment in my landed bases which sometimes leads to explosions.

Anyone notice this problem?

One fix would be to save the ground polygons 1km away or whatever from the base so every single time you load the game it always loads the same.
It's not randomly generated. It is just you have your ground on a low setting.

It's not randomly generated. It is just you have your ground on a low setting.

^^ this. On the lower settings, the ground is higher up than on the higher settings. sounds weird but that's just the way it is. so if u go and launch a base and land it while on high terrain settings, if you change the terrain setting to low, the base will then explode because it will be under the ground.

Hope this helps,

ToTheMun
